newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Satisfaction level in HK up as handover nears.
newsitem.headline: Satisfaction level in HK up as handover nears.

text.p: Most Hong Kong people are satisfied with the current situation in the territory as China moves closer to resuming sovereignty, a government survey showed on Saturday.

Seventy-eight percent of respondents were satisfied with the situation in Hong Kong, up from 76 percent in a March poll, according to the survey, conducted by the Home Affairs Branch between May 12 and 16.
The telephone survey covered 1,503 people between the ages of 15 and 64.

Some 72 percent said they expected Hong Kong to remain prosperous and stable, down from 73 percent in March. Twenty percent expected the situation to improve in the next 12 months, down from 24 percent in March, the survey found.
But 50 percent expected the situation to stay the same in the next 12 months, up from 49 percent previously.
Satisfaction with the government also fell slightly. Only 49 percent expressed satisfaction with the civil service, down from 53 percent previously.
Hong Kong, a British colony for over 150 years, reverts to Chinese rule at midnight on June 30.
